meanings.definition: To throw or drop something from a moving vehicle or ship
meanings.sent1: The sailor was jettisoning old supplies off the boat.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut jettisoned the empty fuel tank into space.
meanings.sent3: The captain joked about jettisoning his annoying crewmate overboard.
meanings.sent4: She felt like jettisoning her worries into the vast ocean of the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The act of jettisoning cargo during the storm was a dramatic moment in the movie.

meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of something unnecessary or burdensome
meanings.sent1: The company was jettisoning outdated equipment to make room for new technology.
meanings.sent2: She decided to jettison the toxic relationship from her life.
meanings.sent3: The cluttered attic needed a good jettisoning of old junk.
meanings.sent4: He felt lighter after jettisoning his heavy workload onto a colleague.
meanings.sent5: The act of jettisoning negative thoughts was like lifting a weight off her shoulders.
